question: You have mentioned that no more than 3 can participate in a Nafl Jamaat per the Hanafi Madhab. If there are several people in the Masjid, does this mean we need to make separate Jamaats of 4 each?
answer:
QUESTION
(Please refer to your response to Q4520). During the last nites of Ramadan, there are many people (in excess of 30) who spend the nite in the Masjid, and would like to participate in Tahajjud and Qiyamullail Salaats. ? Also, I?ll be interested in knowing if the restriction you?ve mentioned exists in the other schools of thought. ? In a multi-madhab society like the Americas, how can one expect to adhere to these kind of restrictions? ? Also if you don?t mind, please explain the source of this restriction, did the prophet s.a.w.s. impose this thru? any hadith at all? If not, wouldn?t you agree that imposing restrictions in Deen, when the prophet s.a.w.s. did not do so, is a form of innovation?
ANSWER


Share:
According to the Hanafi Madhab, no more than 3 people can participate in%0D%0ANafl Salaat together. This does not mean that if there are more people, then%0D%0Aaccordingly several Jamaats of 3 each may gather together. This practice, if%0D%0Acontinued, will lead an innovation. It was not the general practice of%0D%0ARasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) or Sahaaba (Radhiallaahu Anhum) to%0D%0Aperform Nafl Salaat in congregation.%0D%0A%0D%0AIf this practice is done continuously in a way whereby others are invited to%0D%0Aalso participate, then it will be termed as Bid'at. Yes, if it is done very%0D%0Ararely (keeping in mind the restriction of no more than 3 people), then it%0D%0Awill be permissible. As for the restriction of no more than 3 people, this%0D%0Ais found in a Hadith of Hadhrat Anas (Radhiallaahu Anhu) who says that,%0D%0A'Once Nabi (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam) performed Nafl Salaat and behind%0D%0Ahim stood Anas (Radhiallaahu Anhu), a child and Umm Sulaim (Radhiallaahu%0D%0AAnha).%0D%0A%0D%0AThus, the original position of the Shari'ah is that there should not be any%0D%0ANafl Jamaat. This is an exception to the general rule and should thus be%0D%0Aconfined to the conditions mentioned.%0D%0A%0D%0AEach person may perform as much Nafl he wishes individually. This is the%0D%0Arule of the Hanafi Madhab, and every Hanafi should follow this even if the%0D%0Aother members of the Jamaat are of other Madhabs.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0Afor: Mufti Ebrahim Desai%0D%0AFATWA DEPT.%0D%0A%0D%0ACHECKED AND APPROVED: Moulana Imraan Vawda
